Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 01:49 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but two properties in the Shaftesbury Avenue area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair an unexpected underground cabling fault.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Decasta at 00:58
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 23:25 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Shaftesbury Avenue area for safety so they can repair an underground cabling fault. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 01:30-02:30, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 19:46 - We can now confirm that all power in the TN22 3 / RH17 7 area should be back to normal.

Upon investigation, the flickering and reduced voltage was caused by a fault on our overhead cables, which our engineers have now safely repaired. We know that interference with your power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the disruption. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Roland from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be low voltage and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies back to normal. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the TN22 3 / RH17 7 area to investigate the cause of the voltage issues.

Our estimated time frame of 19:30 and 20:30 hasn't changed, but our staff will be checking our network equipment and cabling throughout the area to identify any problems. Depending on what they find, it's possible our time frame may need to change later.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. If you have any concerns, our team are always here on 08003163105. Sent by Roland at 17:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 16:16. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 21:02 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers replaced some equipment at the substation in the Harvest Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 19:36 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the Harvest Road area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 21:30 and 22:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Theo at 18:51.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 15:56 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground/ network in the Broadwater Street area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Kevin, Talie, Dave and Theo are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Sent by Simon at 13:38 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team are now starting excavations, but due to the surface material and how much space will be needed for our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely, we're now estimating power will be back on by 15:00-16:00.

We're sorry to change our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated and our team are always here if you have any questions.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 17:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the Wrythe Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers repaired.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our customer support vehicle is now on site. It's located in the car park of Renaissance Court on Rose Hill Avenue (what3words-atoms.tribal.lonely) and is ready to provide extra support to anyone affected by the power cut.

If you have someone in your property or know of someone who needs extra care or cannot travel to the vehicle, please let us know by calling 08003163105 or tweet us @UKPowerNetworks. Sent by Aaron at 16:28.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Stuart at 09:49 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers replaced network equipment in a nearby substation in the Manor Mount area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 08:20 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Steph and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was an unexpected overhead cable fault that affected 1795 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to report our staff have resolved this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Great news - Our engineers have now restored power to all but three customers in the IP12 3 area by diverting power around the overhead cable fault.

Thank you for your patience while our team worked hard to resolve this issue safely; we're pleased that our engineers were able restore the power within the timeframe we had estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by David at 16:11 - Hi David here. We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 728 customers in the IP12 1 area by repairing a faulted piece of overhead network equipment. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this afternoon. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Aaron at 16:22.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Green Lane area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 17:26
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 18:30-19:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed.  As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by David at 17:11.

Sent by David at 16:23 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the High Street area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 17:45
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Our estimated time frame of 20:00-21:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by David at 17:39.

Sent by David at 20:50 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry for how long power was off for. We can now confirm that all power in the Chequer Field area should be back on. Our engineers have reported that the new temporary generator is on site and has been connected to the electrical network to restore all power to the area.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 20:21 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry that power is still off this evening. I just wanted to let you know. Our engineers have advised that they have asked for a new temporary generator to be ordered to the Chequer Field area and delivered tonight so we can connect it to the network and restore power whilst we take away the faulted generator. At the moment we don't need to change the estimated timeframe. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 22:20 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Military Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 20:41

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 20:41 - We can now confirm that all power in the Ashen Grove Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Ashen Grove Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Hi, this is Decasta - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's David from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 20:37. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 23:19 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 479 customers in the NR9 5 area, by removing debris caught on the overhead cabling. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Decasta - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

Engineers have been in touch to let us know that they have located a branch laying across the overhead conductors. They're in the process of removing it and out estimated time frame of 23:30-00:30 has not changed. 

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in. Sent at 22:30
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 21:53 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 00:17 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 2863 customers in the SS12 9, SS13 2 area, by diverting power around the underground cabling fault. We know a power cut can be difficult; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the SS12 9, SS13 2 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Decasta at 23:44.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent at 23:20 by Aaron - More electricity has been diverted thanks to our ground team's continued work, and the lights are now safely back on to 139 further properties.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 04:53 - I'm very sorry you're still without power.

Our engineers have been waiting for the local water board to complete repairs on the water leak, but due to long working hours, we now need to send out a relief team first thing in the morning. This means that you may not receive any texts for a while.

We'll let you know as soon as our staff re-attend and we have some more information, but if you have any concerns in the meantime you can always reach our team here on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.

Sent by Decasta at 01:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the Victoria Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 00:46 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Victoria Road area, the estimated time of 02:30-03:30 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time.
